newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Piltel falls on talk of low 9-mth net.
newsitem.headline: Piltel falls on talk of low 9-mth net.

text.p: Pilipino Telephone Corp shed 1.50 pesos, or 5.17 percent, to 27.50 pesos in late trade on Tuesday on market talk that its nine-month earnings will not meet expectations, brokers said.
"Its really because their earnings for the first three quarters would be below expectations," said Kevin Khoe, analyst at Sapphire Securities Inc.
"Piltel revenues per phone were miscalculated although their subscriber base is increasing," he said.
Piltel officials were not immediately available for comment.
Khoe said he has downgraded full year earnings forecast from 1.3 billion pesos to 1.1 billion pesos.
Another analyst said he is also planning to trim his 1996 earnings forecast of 1.4 billion pesos.
